item.title: Emote ID's [Delta]
item.description:
@202685 wrote:

OR!!! hes using a delta bluur client, in this case, your screwed, because somewhere along the line, someone messed with adding the gs stances and ended up over writing the emote models… im guess its corby x evolution

Read full topic

item.title: Emote ID's [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:441517”][quote author=matzie link=topic=544215.msg3989311#msg3989311 date=1336346991]

Well I’m a fan of delta and just recently got back into programming one. Anyways, I have the correct emote ID’s in my client but they still come up wrong.

These are my current emote ID’s:

[code] case 168:
// yes emote
c.setAnimation(855);
break;
case 169:
// no emote
c.setAnimation(856);
break;

		case 162:
			// think emote
				c.setAnimation(857);
			break;

		case 164:
			// bow emote
				c.setAnimation(858);
			break;

		case 165:
			// angry emote
				c.setAnimation(859);
			break;

		case 161:
			// cry emote
				c.setAnimation(860);
			break;

		case 170:
			// laugh emote
				c.setAnimation(861);
			break;

		case 171:
			// cheer emote
				c.setAnimation(862);
			break;

		case 163:
			// wave emote
				c.setAnimation(863);
			break;

		case 167:
			// beckon emote
				c.setAnimation(864);
			break;

		case 172:
			// clap emote
				c.setAnimation(865);
			break;

		case 166:
			// dance emote
				c.setAnimation(866);
			break;

		case 52050:
			// panic emote
				c.setAnimation(2105);
			break;

		case 52051:
			// jig emote
				c.setAnimation(2106);
			break;

		case 52052:
			// spin emote;
				c.setAnimation(2107);
			break;

		case 52053:
			// headbang emote
				c.setAnimation(2108);
			break;

		case 52054:
			// joy jump emote
				c.setAnimation(2109);
			break;

		case 52055:
			// rasp' berry emote
				c.setAnimation(2110);
			break;

		case 52056:
			// yawn emote
				c.setAnimation(2111);
			break;

		case 52057:
			// salute emote
				c.setAnimation(2112);
			break;

		case 52058:
			// shrug emote
				c.setAnimation(2113);
			break;

		case 43092:
			// blow kiss emote
				c.setAnimation(0x558);
			break;

		case 2155:
			// glass box emote
				c.setAnimation(1131);
			break;

		case 25103:
			// climb rope emote
				c.setAnimation(1130);
			break;

		case 25106:
			// lean emote
				c.setAnimation(1129);
			break;

		case 2154:
			// glass wall emote
				c.setAnimation(1128);
			break;

		case 52071:
			// goblin bow emote
				c.setAnimation(0x84F);
			break;

		case 52072:
			// goblin dance emote
				c.setAnimation(0x850);
			break;
		case 72032:
			// zombie walk emote
				c.setAnimation(3544);
			break;
		case 72033:
			// zombie walk emote
				c.setAnimation(3543);
			break;[/code]

The ones with 0x or an x in them I did not modify because I don’t know the ID for it. Most of these show weird things like godsword stances.

System.out.println(0x850+"");
outputs the int version of 0x850…
0x850=(8*(16^2)+(5*(16^1))+(0*(16^0))

[/quote]
Huh? Totally lost me there.

Why the hell would you quote that without putting code tags???

Oh and by the way. I am using those… You can find them on google. lol. Not Zodiac’s package.

oh well i just pulled them from his package… what’s your problem then

My problem (As stated in OP) The emotes show up as Godsword stances. NOT EMOTES.[/quote]
^ is to the power of
Its written in hex, learn to convert it?? or type it in the calculator (850) and switch it to decimal form. DUH.

0x850=(8*(16^2))+(5*(16^1))+(0*(16^0))
Given a string of variables i could write an algorithm to decode it :) i could make base 1,000,000 if i had enough characters for it. If you don't understand bases, google it!! Hex is base 16, 0-F (count the number of "characters" that show up, its 16.(include 0) decimal is base 10. (0-9) every time you hit the base number, you incease the following number by 1, like when you hit 9+1, i would turn to (1,0)<-- This is the same as (1*(10^1))+(1*10^0)) 139=(1*(10^2))+(3*(10^1))+(9*(10^0))

binary(base2) works the same way.
0=0
1=1
2=10
3=11
base10=base2=algorithm
100=1100100=(12^6))+(1(2^5))+(0*(2^4))+(0*(2^3))+(1*(2^2))+(0*(2^1))+(0*(2^0))

Read full topic

item.title: Emote ID's [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:441517”][quote author=RemiM link=topic=544215.msg3989340#msg3989340 date=1336348321]
Maybe your client replaced some emotes with godsword stances?
[/quote]

I wouldn’t know. As I got this client from a download. I would assume someone has a fix or at least a good clue on what to do with it.[/quote]

Replace your cache then.

I’ve got the unedited 377 cache if anyone is interested (snagged it before megaupload got shutdown)

Read full topic

item.title: Emote ID's [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well I’m a fan of delta and just recently got back into programming one. Anyways, I have the correct emote ID’s in my client but they still come up wrong.

These are my current emote ID’s:

[code] case 168:
// yes emote
c.setAnimation(855);
break;
case 169:
// no emote
c.setAnimation(856);
break;

		case 162:
			// think emote
				c.setAnimation(857);
			break;

		case 164:
			// bow emote
				c.setAnimation(858);
			break;

		case 165:
			// angry emote
				c.setAnimation(859);
			break;

		case 161:
			// cry emote
				c.setAnimation(860);
			break;

		case 170:
			// laugh emote
				c.setAnimation(861);
			break;

		case 171:
			// cheer emote
				c.setAnimation(862);
			break;

		case 163:
			// wave emote
				c.setAnimation(863);
			break;

		case 167:
			// beckon emote
				c.setAnimation(864);
			break;

		case 172:
			// clap emote
				c.setAnimation(865);
			break;

		case 166:
			// dance emote
				c.setAnimation(866);
			break;

		case 52050:
			// panic emote
				c.setAnimation(2105);
			break;

			break;

			break;

		case 52056:

		case 52057:

		case 72032:

			break;
		case 72033:
			// zombie walk emote
				c.setAnimation(3543);
			break;[/code]

The ones with 0x or an x in them I did not modify because I don’t know the ID for it. Most of these show weird things like godsword stances.
